author: starwarsman52
title: I got them!
review:
Before I review this set, I must tell you. I went to the Czech Republic, looked for days to find new star wars sets, and I found all 8 of the new winter ones. It's at a place called Zuraco Toys! This set is soo cool. The minifigs are awesome. You get 8 regualr battle droids, 2 new pilot droids, a new gungan warrior, and JAR JAR. The pilots are new because instead of having a solid blue torso, in the middle some of the blue is replaced with regular battle droid color, but it's not a big deal. Jar Jar is very cool. Double sided torso and he has real pupils and light red gungan skin. The gungan warrior is by far the best figure in this set. He has also real pupils with a purple gungan mask and his shield his insanely awesome.(also, for those who thought his legs were transparent, there not.) The carrier is very cool too.
  • Pros:
  • lots of battle droids
  • awesome gungans
  • nice carrier
  • Cons:
  • not enough gungans
  • too much money for a small carrier
  • wasted too much time putting the battle droids into fold-up position

author: scorpion_156
title: Dont think  you can find it in england
review:
First of all i got this in Romania for cheap in a toys store. Witch  is pretty cool
This set rocks Cool figure lots of droids jar jar shield 1 more gungan

weapons
guns
droids lots of them

Apart from that con awesome set

author: captainrex501st
title: Finally! A Set That is Worth it's Price!
review:
Well just to start off this set is very good. It includes eight regular Droids, two blue Droids and even a new Jar Jar and Gunkan warrior. This is definitely worth it's price in mini-figures. The vehicle it's self is very long and slim. It has a very nice color scheme and it still has that old light from the original set. Overall it is very good but the down side is that the plastic on this set and many other 2011 sets are partially made in china and have been found to break easily.

Pros:

Good minifigures
Lots of minifigures
Very detailed
Worth it's price

Cons:

Chinese plastic

author: nachoswolf
title: Great gungans & great army builder!
review:
Overall

well, I just got this set, and I like it! especially the gungans with an awesome new design, too bad they aren't going to make more of them. The set is the greatest army builder of this time for droids, but I miss a commander and droideka.


The Build

It's not a big business to build, just the droids and the capsule thing the are inside.

gungan heads and the shield, thats it, and some nice parts on the ship to ;).


Playability

alone: great enough

together with other sets: AWESOME :D


Value for money

Like almost all SW sets: bad


PROS:

- nice carrier
- lots of droids
- army builder

CONS:

Nachoswolf

author: wander099
title: Great Army Builder!
review:
Box/Instructions

The box is pretty nice, like all the new 2011 Star Wars sets.

Parts

There are some new parts in this set and a nice amount of tan pieces that can be used to build your own things.  But, most of the parts are fairly standard, we've seen most of it before.

Minifigures

With this set, the minifigures are the main attraction.  You get 8 standard battle droids, two new pilot droids, one gungan soldier, and the new Jar Jar Binks.  This is a great army builder for droids, but I had hoped for more Gungans.

The build

The build was fairly simple and with only 241 pieces it didn't take very long to complete.  The only trouble I ran into was I couldn't find one of the pieces for a few minutes, but that was my own fault for not looking properly.

The completed model

Overall, the ship is nice.  With or without the droids on the back, it makes a nice vehicle to play with.  The things on the bottom that look like skiis make it slide along the table nicely and the model is smooth and aerodynamic.

Summary

I picked up this set for $35 CDN, and overall I would recommend it to any Star Wars fan or army builder.  It's not a bad price (comparatively) and it definately delivers with the 12 minifigures included.

author: CapnRex101
title: 7929 - Battle Of Naboo
review:
This set is pretty good, it is worth the money you pay for it, but lacks a certain something which some of the other recent sets have had. I just don't think the set is quite up to the same standard as some of the others from this January 2011 wave, which is a shame, but is still a nice model.

Box/Instructions

The box art for this set shows the Droid Transport Craft speeding across the lush plains of Naboo. Laser blasts and explosions are scattered all over the place and Jar Jar is fleeing with a Gungan soldier, possibly Captain Roos Tarpals, who accompanies General Binks throughout the battle. Battle droids which have already been unloaded are firing at the two Gungans. Several MTTs and AATs are just coming over the hill in the background ready to finish off the Gungan army.

The instructions were just fine, no mistakes and I had no missing pieces.

Parts

There are a few interesting new parts in this set, particularly the two Gungan heads and the plasma shield which are all highly detailed. Also we get many parts in various shades of brown and tan which are very useful for creating your own models.

Minifigures

There are some cool Minifigures in this set, but none of them are of the same standard as others such as Aurra Sing, Shaak Ti, Embo, the Tactical Droid and of course my personal favourite, Saesee Tiin. The two Gungans are the highlights of the figures, with some excellent detailing on them and their accessories. I especially like the new shield, which looks very much like the ones used in the Battle of Naboo from The Phantom Menace. We get a lot of Minifigures for our money, twelve! These are the two Gungans, two new pilot battle droids and eight normal battle droids (which you can never have to many of). The pilot droids have now got a small area of tan printing, which introduces some detail to the figure, unlike the pilot which features in the Separatist Shuttle set from 2009 which has an all blue torso.

The build

The build took me about fifteen minutes, it almost took longer to build the Minifigures than the vehicle itself! The build is very straightforward, there are no complicated building techniques used, so it should be very easy. 

The completed model

The model looks pretty good as a whole, with a well designed droid storage rack, much like that of the MTT from 2007, and some nice bodywork. The set however is really improved by the Minifigures. Yet still as neither the figures nor the speeder are particularly outstanding, I find it hard to be amazed by this set. I do however like the ability to easily remove the droid storage rack.

Summary

I have to say this is probably one of the weaker sets of the first wave of 2011, however I do still really like it, and I think it is somewhat overshadowed by the brilliance of other sets like Mace Windu's Jedi Starfighter, the Bounty Hunter Gunship and the spectacular T-6 Jedi Shuttle. Certainly a useful set for creating your droid army, and that is reflected in my overall score.


Overall - 8/10

author: sudorum
title: Binks is Back
review: A lone droid skiff really can't be considered an entire battle scene, which the title of the set claims it is. You'll need the MTT for that. Overall, this an average set to add to your collection. The improved Jar-Jar Binks and the Gungan with the purple shield are the highlights. The droid rack on the skiff is similar to the MTT droid rack, but holds only half as many droids, due to the spots for the guns. Also, the rack of droids can separate from the skiff, and the individual platforms that the droids rest on can be removed. This set goes well with the MTT, especially if you want a complete Naboo battle scene.

author: legoclone
title: Like buying 3 battle packs and getting a good vehicle thrown in
review: I was pleasantly surprised by how much I liked this set.   It was an impulse buy just because I wanted a Star Wars Lego set and I saw this one I didn’t have just sitting there on the shelf.  First off, this thing is the ultimate army builder. For what amounts to about the price of about 2 battle backs you get 12 figures to include 8 standard battle droids AND a solid vehicle.   Lego did a real good job of capturing the look of the Trade Federation troop carrier.  What is more, if you have enough battle droids you can double the carrying capacity of the vehicles droid rack simply by removing the 2x2 holder plates for the blasters (since the droids can hold their own blasters, even when folded) and have the droids sit right next to each other.  I am even toying with the idea of extending the length of the droid track by only 2 studs which would allow it to hold a total of 20 folded battle droids – only 4 plate pieces would need to be switched out – which would still look good since the end of the vehicle sticks out past the rack. The Gungans are well done as well with elaborate head pieces which are a vast improvement over the old style single colored head Gungans.  I also like the new transparent shield.  I have to say this set was really worth buying. My one complaint, and it isn’t really about this set but about battle droids in generals, is that I wish their legs were separate from each other.  I don’t know, maybe they would be too flimsy but that way but they would be nicer for posing.

author: lesar3
title: 12 Minifigs!
review:
Battle of Naboo

24.99$

Box/Instructions

Box is pretty small and instructions are normal... nothing special on them

Parts

241 parts... I think its very good part amount for price you pay

Minifigures

Ah, the best part of set

8 Normal droids, nothing new on them, same as they always were been

2 Pilot droids, normal battle droids, just with colored torso, nothing special, but great addition to your army

2 Gungans,they are wonderfully designed, print on the head, and both sides of torso... really awesome figures, much better than older ones

And you get new trans-purple shield with them

The build

Simple, no complicated parts or anything similar

The completed model

very good, it's 25 cm long and 7 cm wide, very good design 

Summary

A must have set if you're a Separatist collector, great for building army of droids.

everything is great about this set, I can't remember any cons

I recommend this set!

author: legodude357
title: A great droid army builder.
review:
I went to the store intent on buying the Imperial V-wing starfighter. But at Target there was a display that had the 2011 battle packs, and this set along with the bounty hunter gunship. I set down the V-wing and picked up this. I really want that Jar-Jar minifig. I thought. I'd never had one before. Plus, there's a second gungan as well! Plus, the old droid piliots with white printing in the middle of their chests. PLUS x8 battle droids. You can never have enough battle droids. I decided to buy the Battle of Naboo.

 

Skiff

The skiff is excellently made for something that I myself saw in Episode 1 for all of 1 second, but is lacking in special play features, or interesting peices. Its a basic, boring build I completed very quickly. Like 2-3 minutes. The majority of that time was placing together all the battle droids.

 

Figures

Ah, the real reason to get this set. When I built this I got one of my baseplates, placed the box behind the figures, and found that there are enough figures with one stud spacing between them to fill the length of the box, and have two figures not in the perimeter of the box. Wow! But, the reason why there are so many figures is this: after reading Star Wars the visual dictionary, I am now very, um, stepical of legos. What they do is determine a price point, and build something that MIGHT justify that price. If it doesn't, they add extras figures or features. They should build a model, either from the clone wars series tv show, or a rehash, then price it. But they don't. Anyway, if your droid army is lacking or you don't have one, this set will give you all you need to fill the gap. Jar-Jar and Captain Roo Tarpals are greatly printed, with detailing on their ears, along with a double printed torso. This set is worth it for the figures alone.

 

Summary

A great looking set which has a plethora of figures, along with a great versitile vechile, as I prefer the older tan and brown droid vechiles as opposed to Blue and grey of the clone wars. I have already built an entire battle of Naboo moc, just because this set inspired me to. If you just want the figures thats fine, the skiff makes an excellent pile of plates and bricks to add to your spare parts box. I do not regret spending the cash on this, and reccomend it to a friend. Thank you for reading my review!

author: BrickMaster_99
title: The Battle of Naboo!
review: This set comes with twelve figures in all, but two of them are unique and extremely rare figures, Jar Jar Binks and a Gungan Warrior. There are also two droid pilots and eight plain battle droids. The plain droids can all fit onto a rack (similar to the MTT's but smaller.) The Gungan Warrior's shield is cool, but his bomb staff needs some work. Jar Jar's Bomb holder is a little plain, but all in all it is a pretty good set.

author: Starguy
title: The battle of naboo is on!
review:
Pros

jar jar

gungan soldier

battle droids

redesigned pilots

size

cons

should of been a trade federation aat

should be more battle droids

overall amazing set

author: brickgalaxy
title: Epic Battle Pack
review:
The Battle of Naboo is not a perfect set, but that's ok -- it doesn't try to be. At its core, this set is a battle pack -- and a big battle pack at that. The set comes with 12 minifigures, which is a whopping amount for a $25 set, and a dream come true for those who want a relatively cheap way to build up a Battle Droid Army.

The Battle Droid minifigures are exactly what you'd expect them to be, which is not a bad thing at all -- we like some consistency, and their design is pretty tried and true at this point. From a minifigure point of view, the real stars of the show here are the Gungans. LEGO did such an amazing job with these minifigures. They're just outstanding minifigures that anyone will be able to appreciate -- and it doesn't hurt that their accessories are great as well.

The Battle Droid Carrier itself is a good little set, and I consider it to be a nice improvement over the 2001 version. The droid rack on the back is similar to the one found on the MTT. It can store all eight battle droids and a blaster for each, and there is a seat in the front for each of the Battle Droid Pilots. As you would hope, the droid rack is removable. It slides off and pops back on with ease.

Playability-wise, there isn't a lot you can do with this set on its own, and that's ok. As with all battle packs, this is a supplementary set. The value it adds to your collection is greater than its standalone value.

author: Andabain
title: Great minifigures!
review: The battle of Naboo is a great set. The minifigures are obviously the highlight of this set. The set comes with 10 Droids, (8 regular, 2 pilot) and 2 Gungans including Jar-Jar. The pilot droids have a new look, the torso is not completly blue. The Gungans look really good, more realistic now. The shield that one of them has is pretty cool as well. If you play with set alot the Droids often fall off of the transporter, but other than that it is on of the best sets this year!

author: legofan666666
title: The Battle of Naboo
review:
This set is amazing! I already bought three of them because I love it so much! I plan to buy more in the future. Everything in this set is great and fun to play with. This set is an amzing army builder.

 

Minifigures:  The minifigures in this set are the best part. Twelve figures in a thirty dollar set is an amazing deal. I love jar jar. He has a unique head piece that is the most detailed minifigure headpiece i have ever see. The Gungan Soldier also has a similar head with the same amazing detail. There are 10 battle droids in this set (8 normal battle droids, 2 pilot) ! That is why this set is an amazing army builder. It makes this set perfect for MOCs. All battle droids have one straight arm and come with a short blaster. The pilot droids have amazing detail as well.

 

Set: I love this set! The pull-off droid rack feature is a great addition. It is great for stop motion videos and brickfilms. The droid carrier is equiped with a head light and beautiful detail. It contains lots of tan curved pieces. Some very rare pieces in this set.

 

 

Extras: As I stated before this set is great for star wars MOCs and brickfilms. It is a great army builder. You almost need this set to make a perfect battle of naboo MOC. This set is US $30.00 and contains 241 pieces. Go out and buy one of these soon!

author: tommy216a
title: "Jump Jar Jar, jump!"
review:
This is easily the best battle droid army builder available today and the best Lego Star Wars set from the 2011 Winter Line. In order to have a droid army, you have to have this set. With 8 regular battle droids, 2 redesigned battle droid pilots, and 2 redesigned gungans that have not been made in 11 years, this is a must have set for any Lego Star Wars fan.

Pros

             8 battle droids

             2 new battle droid pilots

             1 new gungan soldier

             1 new Jar Jar Binks

             New trans-purple shield

             Battle droid carrier can fit all 10 droids on it

             The carrier is sturdy

            

Cons

  • Not much playability

 

This is kind of like a big version of a battle pack. The $25 price point is very worth it. Although I would have paid $5 more for 1-2 more gungans, one of those horse-type creatures the gungans ride, and the carriage-type thing that holds the boomers, but the set is already great. Overall, I give this a 5 out of 5.

author: Huge_Nerd
title: We can drive it home...with one headlight.
review:
I also got this set for Christmas after drooling over it every time I passed it in the store.

As others have mentioned the main draw is the minifigs. Jar-Jar and the Gungan warrior have amazing head pieces and nice torsos and the warrior's translucent purple shield is is very unique and looks very nice. The two battle droid pilots have some beige printing to make them look more movie accurate as well--a nice touch. Of course, the eight regular battle droids provide one with an instant army.

Honestly, the actually vehicle model was a mere afterthought for me in desiring this set, but I was pleasantly surprised by it. While relatively simple, it is larger and more substantial than I thought it would be. It is also very solid. The mix of tan, brown, grays and the beige of the battle droids all blend nicely. The whole vehicle makes me think of an insect or larva.The little horns and the headlight are nice touches--the latter inspired me to sing "One Headlight" by the Wallflowers as I built it (thus my title for this review).

I find this set to be a great set in its own right as well as an adequate lower priced alternative to the larger MTT.

author: legobuilderstudios
title: Battle of Naboo
review:
First off, I'd like to say that this set is really good especially for the value for money. The reason is because you get 8 basic battle droids, 2 droid pilots, a new Gungan warrior and a new version of Jar-Jar. Now, as they say, lets get on with the review!

Box/Instructions

The design of the box is very appealing, as it shows the droid carrier come into sight with Jar Jar and the Gungan warrior.
The instructions are pretty basic and easy to follow.

Parts

There is a total of 241 parts (including minifigures). The real nice pieces in it are the dark tan wedge 4 x 4 piece, the trans purple shield and the good amount of 2 x 2 light bluish grey plate with studs on it.

Minifigures

The figures you get are 8x regular battle droids with one bent arm and one straight arm, 2x droid pilots, a Gungan warrior and a new Jar Jar.

Battle droid: Not much to say here, it is your regular battle droid with one bent arm and one straight arm.

Droid pilot: These pilots are nice! Especially the blue droid chest piece with Tan print.

Gungan warrior: One of the key figures of the set. The head mold mold is new compared to the old Gungan warrior, but I will explain that on Jar Jar. The Gungan warrior has a nice Shield with a good design on it. The torso print is also fantastic as well! Much more accurate than the old one.

Jar Jar: This figure was the main reason why I got this set, since I never owned the old one, I had to get the new one to add to my collection. The head mold is new, and I will tell you why. The reason is because the old Gungan head mold had splittened eyes, while the new one has Flat eyes. But I couldn't really care, as I now have a Jar Jar. Jar Jar has a nice new print on his torso which represents the rags he wore.

The build

The build wasn't to tricky, so all I will tell you is that building it is actually quite easy.

The completed model

The completed model represents the Platoon Attack Craft (PAC). The model is extremely nice.

Summary

Overall, this set is really worth getting. The playability for a child is good, so If you have a younger sibling they most likely will enjoy. If you are a collector, this one is a straight on buy! Basically because it looks well on the shelve. Overall, I recommend this set!

author: McJoJo_McBob
title: 7929-The Battle of Naboo
review:
My mom recently bought this set for me at Stop + Shop in an agreement that I wouldn't get another LEGO set for 2 months, but the next day I got 3 more. This set has a lot of playability for what you get inside.

Box/Instructions

The box art appears to be obviously during The Battle of Naboo.Jar Jar Binks appears to be leading the Gungan Army in to The Battle of the Grassy Plains.Three of the battle droids that were originally on the droid carrier are down on the ground trying to shoot Jar Jar and the Gungan Soldier who appear in the set.Jar Jar seems to be throwing one of the two boomas he comes with, while the Gungan Soldier is running around in front of the droid carrier, holding his energy shield and what appears to be a cesta and booma.The back of the box is Jar Jar and the Gungan sneaking away as the droid carrier is being unloaded.


The instructions had no mistakes and I had no missing pieces.


Minifigures

Jar Jar and the Gungan are excellent. What looks like they have the original head mold, this one is new without holes in the eyes,so LEGO could paint them.Sadly, the head on the Gungans are Chinese, but luckily the rest of them are Danish. Both of them have back printing, hidden under their huge ears. Their uniforms are accurate to how they looked in Episode 1 and in The Clone Wars.Jar Jar wears the original tattered clothing as the original minifigure but with more detail.Also, this time he has head printing.The Gungan Soldier wears the uniform of the real Gungan Army in the movie.


This set is a really good droid army builder,with 8 regular droids in it. Also the pilots have a new torso printing, with all blue and a small area in the middle that is tan.This torso also appeared later in the year as the torso of the pilot in the advent calendar on day 11.


Parts

This set does not come with very many,unless you wanted to use the droids or ski pieces in a MOC or something of that nature.Also,the big inverted radar dishes could somehow become useful.


The Build

The build is a bit repetitive,especially with the minifigures. It is repetitive on the droid shelves, but you can hardly tell.The build is simple,and took me about 30 minutes.


The Completed Model

The finished droid carrier is very accurate to how they look in The Invasion of Naboo,heading in the convoy of Trade Federation units, as they pushed to the capital,Theed.


Summary

Overall,I say this is a set that should stand proudly on any Star Wars or LEGO fan's shelf so every one who walks by can see it.

author: StratTone
title: One of the best for the mid price sets.
review: Wow where to start.  This set is another of the mid-level sets that blew me away.  Very fun to build, lots and lots of droids if you army build, and great looking top to bottom.  I had a blast getting my moneys worth in this set.  Im not even a big Episode 1-3 fan and I loved it.

author: LegoCollector125
title: "Ouch Time."
review:
Though I had initaially intended to purchase the Sith Nightspeeder when I got this set, seeing as they were sold out I figured I might as well pick this one up to get the new Gungans.  

Box/Instructions

The set's box is visally appealing, as usual, and features the Clone Trooper with lightning motif of the recent sets. The instructions, as always, are easy to follow, and colors are weel defined.

Parts

The set includes a nice selection of parts, with a good amount of the new dark tan color bricks.

Minifigures

The battle droids are just, well, battle droids. Never can have to many of those. The pilots are redesigned, instead of having the full blue torso, it has a blue torso piece with tan printing where the blue was on the original pilot droid. The Gungans are fully redesigned, with Jar Jar having the same torso pattern, except with new gray colors and different arms. The head molds of both Gungans remain the same, except now with more detail. Captain Tarpals (or the Gungan Warrior whatever you'd like to call him) has a new chest print as well as a new transparent shield.

The build

A few interesting techniques are used in the build, but otherwise, it isn't all that special.

The completed model

The final product is, first of all, much larger than it appears at first glance. The carrier is quite nice looking, but the only feature is the detaching droid rack. The set has good playability as well, including 10 battle droids total and the 2 Gungans.

Summary

Overall, not a bad set, nice figures, and not a bad finished product. It is certainly an improvement from the original droid carrier, but also interestingly showcases some of the same features, like the single headlight in the front and the large cover in front of the pilot. I recommend it, but like all licensed themes nowadays, it is a bit high on the price point. Only a must have if you are a big fan of Gungan Warriors or if you are looking to build up your droid army.

author: lego_maniac_1905
title: The separatists are attacking
review:
This has to be the best star wars 2011 set and a really good droid army builder.

Pros

  • 10 battle droids
  • New JarJar binks and gungan soldier minifigures
  • Cool new translutant purple shield
  • Vehicle can hold up to 10 battle droids 

Cons

  • Very fiddly trying to get the battle droids into the cockpit                                               

Overall this is a brilliant and must get star wars set.

author: tkettle9719
title: The Biggest Battle Pack
review:
I got this set from my grandparents for my birthday a year ago, and I think that it is the best mid-priced minifigures set ever.

Pros

  • -The troop carrier is small, but looks quite nice.
  • -The new Gungans are excellent minifigs.
  • …

Cons

  • -The name is a but misleading.
  • -I also think that declusion of a light on the other side is strange.
  • …
This is an excellent set, and definitely has a ton of battle droids for the collection. I highly recommend this set.

author: redbrick5
title: Brilliant,Ithink they should make more sets like this
review: I got this as a christmas present and i was thrilled when i built it.It doesn't look to big when you're building it but it is big.The gungan's head (including jar jar's) has brilliant detail.Although i think they should have more gungan's.

author: lewishemley
title: overall a good model but........
review: the model is good overall but the set does have a few shortcommings. those beinng that the arrangement of the battledroids in the rear compart ment was not close the the real thing. in the movies the droids are aranged side by side not in a staggered position as indecated in the model.

author: Legofan9898
title: Good Set, for the Figures!
review:
Very Nice Minifigures!

Pros

  • This is just like a huge droid battle pack
  • Lots of minifigures for only $24.99
  • Great Army Builder

Cons

  • Set is not too great
  • It comes with Jar Jar :)

Over all it is a good set for Army Builders!

author: Tar_Domo
title: A Great Set For Army Building
review:
Invasion of Naboo has started. The Trade Federation droid army has landed. It´s time for the gungans to help the humans in the Battle Of Naboo.

This is a great set for building a droid army. You get a nice vehicle and two gungans also. Great value for money in my opinion.

This cost about 30 Euros when I bought it and nowadays you have to pay about 50 Euros for a new one. This is a retired set.

Box/Instructions

The box was quite small. The instructions were easy to follow.

Parts

This has not a lot of exclusive parts. Most of it´s pieces are standard bricks combined in a new way. Tt has not great potential for building MOCs.

Minifigures

This is the great part of the set. It really contains 8 standard battle droids and 2 pilot battle droids. And even the new MTT has just 7 standard battle droids and is a lot more expensive. This also contains 2 gungans, Jar Jar Binks and a gungan soldier.

Standard battle droids - I don´t think there´s a lot new information to tell about them. They have a straight arm and a curved arm as usually. They all have the basic blasters.

Pilot battle droids - They are the 2011 version that is a little bit different than the version you get from nowadays LEGOs. They are weaponless and come with two curved arms.

Jar Jar Binks - He is not an exclusive character anymore. He has some energy balls that are nice though. They are for the Battle Of Naboo.

Gungan soldier - He is the only exclusive minifigure in this set. He has an energy shield for protecting himself and a kind of stick where is that energy thing. He is a good add to the set and has an exclusive headpiece.

The build

Building this was quite easy and fast. There were not any very interesting moments or problems. Kind of "standard-building".

The completed model

The completed model is great. It´s a bigger one battle droid carrier. It can carry 8 battle droids with their weapons or 16 battle droids without weapon platforms if you fix it a little bit. The carrying thing is easy to get off from the vehicle. The vehicle itself has no flick-fire missiles or any weapons. The battle droid pilots have nice spots in the vehicle.

Overall opinion

This is a great set for army builders. It´s also a set for Episode 1 fans and collectors. I recommend it.
